ancestry.name: Kobold
languages: Additional languages equal to your Intelligence modifier (if it's positive). Choose from {@language Aklo}, {@language Dwarven}, {@language Gnomish}, {@language Infernal}, {@language Terran}, {@language Undercommon}, and any other languages to which you have access (such as the languages prevalent in your region).

features.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in darkness and dim light just as well as you can see in bright light, though your vision in darkness is in black and white.

features.name: Draconic Exemplar
entries: You draw minor powers from your draconic exemplar. Choose a type of chromatic or metallic dragon to be your exemplar. This determines your scale color and appearance, and dragons sometimes look more favorably upon those kobolds who resemble them, at the GM's discretion. Your exemplar may also determine details of other abilities you have, using the Draconic Exemplars table.

Every kobold knows that their slight frame belies true, mighty draconic power. They are ingenious crafters and devoted allies within their warrens, but those who trespass into their territory find them to be inspired skirmishers, especially when they have the backing of a draconic sorcerer or true dragon overlord. However, these reptilian opportunists prove happy to cooperate with other humanoids when it's to their benefit, combining caution and cunning to make their fortunes in the wider world.

heritage.name: Cavern Kobold
entries: You hatched into a warren among narrow tunnels and countless kin. Your body is flexible. When {@action Climb|CRB|Climbing} rock walls, stalactites, and other natural stone features, you move at half your Speed on a success and at full Speed on a critical success (and you move at full Speed on a success if you have {@feat Quick Climb}). This doesn't affect you if you're using a climb Speed. If you roll a success on an {@skill Acrobatics} check to {@action Squeeze}, you get a critical success instead.

heritage.name: Dragonscaled Kobold
entries: Your scales are especially colorful, possessing some of the same resistance a dragon possesses. You gain resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1) to the damage type associated with your draconic exemplar (see Table 1–1). Double this resistance against dragons' Breath Weapons.

heritage.name: Spellscale Kobold
entries: A trace of draconic magic flows through your veins. Choose one cantrip from the {@filter arcane spell list|spells||tradition & spell list=arcane|level=0}. You can {@action Cast a Spell|CRB|Cast this Spell} as an arcane innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. You gain the trained proficiency rank in arcane spell attack rolls and spell DCs, and your key spellcasting ability is Charisma.

heritage.name: Strongjaw Kobold
entries: Your bloodline is noted for their powerful jaws and sharp teeth. You gain a jaws unarmed attack that deals {@damage 1d6} piercing damage. Your jaws are in the brawling group and have the {@trait finesse} and {@trait unarmed} traits.

heritage.name: Venomtail Kobold
entries: A vestigial spur in your tail secretes one dose of deadly venom each day. You gain the Tail Toxin action.

You apply your tail's venom to a piercing or slashing weapon. If your next {@action Strike} with that weapon before the end of your next turn hits and deals damage, you deal {@condition persistent damage|CRB|persistent poison damage} equal to your level to the target.
entries.name: Tail Toxin
entries.requirements: You are wielding a piercing or slashing weapon.

heritage.name: Caveclimber Kobold
entries: You live in a vertically-oriented home, and you're a consummate climber. You gain the {@feat Combat Climber} skill feat, even if you don't meet the prerequisites. You can use your clawed feet and tail to {@action Climb}, leaving your hands free. Additionally, if you succeed at an {@skill Athletics} check to {@action Climb}, you critically succeed instead.

heritage.name: Tunnelflood Kobold
entries: You grew up in a warren crisscrossed by underwater passages, whether natural or excavated. You gain a swim Speed of 15 feet.
